data.name: Accessory Vendor
data.desc: Used to buy, sell, and equip various cosmetics that other players can see.
data.location: Usually at the front desk of a clothing store.

data.name: ATM
data.desc: Used to deposit and withdraw money, as well as taking out loans. A loan cannot be taken out if you currently have one that is not paid off.
data.location: Usually in the main lobby of the city bank.

data.name: Banker
data.desc: Used to cash-in checks and money bags. To use, press your use key on a check or money bag that is in range of the NPC.
data.location: Usually standing along a road on the opposite side of the map from the bank.

data.name: Car Dealer
data.desc: Used to buy, sell, and store vehicles. When selling a vehicle, you will receive 75% of what you bought it for. Spawning a new vehicle will remove and store your old one, so be aware of the rules surrounding that.
data.location: Front desk of the car dealership.

data.name: Contraband Dealer
data.desc: Sells a variety of items that are illegal by default such as weed plants and money printers. The mayor can decide for each item whether or not it should remain illegal.
data.location: Usually at the end of alleys located in between buildings.

data.name: Drug Dealer
data.desc: Used to sell weed, meth, and cocaine. To sell your drugs, press your use key on a drug that is in range of the NPC. Government and police jobs have to wait 30 seconds before the money is dropped.
data.location: Usually in an alley or along an outskirts road, away from popular areas.

data.name: Dumpster
data.desc: Used to find items. Normal items have a 40% chance of spawning, and can range from simple fish bait to a crafting blueprint. Rare items have a 1% chance of spawning, and include drugs and weapons. Once a dumpster is searched, a 2 minute cooldown will be in effect before it can be searched again.
data.location: Parking lots of popular buildings such as stores, gas stations, car dealerships, and hospitals.

data.name: Farmer
data.desc: Used to sell farm food from crates. The amount of money you get depends on the types of food and their amounts.
data.location: Usually in grassy areas of the main city such as parks or gardens.

data.name: Firefighter
data.desc: Used by firefighters to spawn fire trucks and ambulances.
data.location: Front desk or main lobby of the fire station.

data.name: Fisherman
data.desc: Used to purchase fishing equipment such as bait, rods, and cages. Once you have caught some fish, you can go back and sell them for a profit.
data.location: Usually on a dock near a large body of water.

data.name: Gas Pumps
data.desc: Used as a faster but more expensive alternative to fuel cans. Pumping cas costs $300 (plus sales tax, if any) for civilians and is free to police and government jobs.
data.location: All gas stations.

data.name: Government Bank Vault
data.desc: Large vault that can hold up to $20,000. To rob, press your use key on the money pallet and money bags will spawn in front of you. The police will automatically be alerted to the robbery as soon as it starts. You can keep robbing until the amount reaches zero. After you are done robbing, you must take the bags to the banker NPC to get the cash.
data.location: Inside the vault of the city bank.

data.name: Healer
data.desc: Sells items to replenish health and armor.
data.location: Front desk of the hospital.

data.name: Smelter
data.desc: Used to turn craftable items back into iron, and to smelt raw ores into precious materials to be used in crafting. Touch a compatible item with it to start the smelting process. Smelting time varies depending on how much the item is worth. Up to 3 items can be processed at once.
data.location: Usually in industrial areas of the main city.

data.name: Item Bank
data.desc: Storage unit that acts as a static, extended version of the player's inventory.
data.location: Main lobby of the city bank, usually near the ATMs.

data.name: Jailbreaker
data.desc: Used by criminals who have been arrested to break out of jail. To use, someone must first break you out of your cell. You can then press your use key on the jailbreaker to initiate a timer that will free you once it ends. Note that the police will be notified when the timer starts.
data.location: Near the front desk of the police station.

data.name: Mayors Secretary
data.desc: Used to enter the mayor elections. Elections will start once at least two players have entered. Elections will not start if there is already a mayor in office.
data.location: Front desk of city hall.

data.name: Police Bank Vault
data.desc: Smaller vault that can hold up to $5,000. To rob, press your use key on the money pile and wait for the timer to finish. The police will be alerted to the robbery as soon as it starts. Leaving the area before the timer ends will cause the robbery to fail.
data.location: Usually in an empty room in a secure area of the police station.

data.name: Police Secretary
data.desc: Used by law enforcement and government officials to spawn police cars, SWAT trucks, and the mayor's limo.
data.location: Front desk of the police station.

data.name: Purifier
data.desc: Purifies cocaine into a form that can be sold or consumed. To use, touch raw cocaine with the purifier. Each raw coke can take up to 10 minutes to purify, but you can stop the purifying process early to get a better purity by pressing your use key on the purifier. Once the coke is done purifying, it will spawn next to the purifier.

data.name: Rock and Tree Grinders
data.desc: Accepts cartloads of logs or ores. To use, fill a cart with ores or logs and take it to the appropriate grinder. Grinding time and cash earned depends on the amount of logs and the type of ores that are being processed.
data.location: Usually in grassy areas along main roads.

data.name: Supermarket
data.desc: Sells a wide variety of items such as low-grade weapons, vehicle repair tools, and media players. The supermarket only sells items that are legal by default, although some items that are sold can be used illegally.Items sold here are affected by sales tax set by the mayor.
data.location: Stores located in popular areas of the city and/or outskirts.

data.name: Smuggle Seller
data.desc: Used to buy illegal items to be shipped to the smuggle buyer. Items that can be smuggled vary in price, but the more expensive the item is, the higher the reward and risk.
data.location: Usually in a parking lot in the main city.

data.name: Smuggle Buyer
data.desc: Used to sell illegal items that were bought from the smuggle seller. To use, press your use key on the NPC with the your truck nearby. You will then receive payment for the smuggle and the truck will be removed.
data.location: Usually in outskirts as far away from the main city as possible.

data.name: Soda Machine
data.desc: Vending machine that deposits sodas, which restore a small amount of health. Each soda costs $30.
data.location: Near the entrance of popular buildings such as city hall, PD, and the bank.

data.name: Tower
data.desc: Used by the mechanic to spawn tow trucks.
data.location: Front desk of the garage or repair shop.

data.name: Speed Radar
data.desc: Tracks the speed of a vehicle. To place it, aim close to the ground and left click. To remove it, walk up to it and right click. The fastest speed the radar has detected will be displayed on the radar itself, but it will send a notification to the officer who owns it whenever a speeder passes by.
data.user: All police jobs except undercover officer

data.name: Handheld Speed Radar
data.desc: Handheld and more concealed version of the speed radar. Left click while looking at a moving vehicle to get a speed reading.

data.name: Police Handcuffs
data.desc: Restrains a player to prevent them from using weapons or running away. To cuff a player, left click. To uncuff a player, press your use key on them.

data.name: Police Leash
data.desc: Similar to the police handcuffs but allows the detaining officer to drag the cuffed player along with them. Press reload while looking at a cuffed player to attach the leash.

data.name: Police Badge
data.desc: Shiny badge to show the public that you are a real cop.

data.name: Spike Strip
data.desc: Stops a vehicle by popping its tires. Vehicles with popped tires won't stop immediately after running over the strip. They will continue to move for a few seconds before slowing down enough to be stopped by another force. Spike strips that are left on the ground for 10 minutes will be removed and given back to the officer who placed it.
data.user: All police jobs except undercover officer

data.name: Taser
data.desc: Non-lethal weapon that delivers a high-voltage shock to its target, preventing them from moving temporarily. Takes 3 seconds to charge up before firing.

data.name: Handheld Metal Detector
data.desc: Scans for any weapons that the target player may have on them. If weapons are detected, the device will beep and display what weapons were found in the user's chat. Unlike the large walk-through metal detector, this will not detect explosives or weapons in a players inventory.

data.name: Battering Ram
data.desc: Breaks down doors owned by players with active search warrants. Right click to hold it up into position and left click in front of the target door to force it open.
data.user: All police jobs except undercover officer

data.name: Arrest/Unarrest Sticks
data.desc: The arrest stick teleports a player to jail after they have been cuffed. Users can select how long the arrestee is in jail for by left clicking on them. The unarrest stick releases a person from jail early and teleports them back to spawn.
data.user: Police Chief, Police Officer, Undercover Officer, IA Agent

data.name: Confiscation Tool
data.desc: Allows user to view and take illegal weapons and tools from the target player's weapon slots. Confiscated items will be given to the user, or spawned next to them if the user already has the same item. Only works on handcuffed players.

data.name: Car Bomb Checker
data.desc: Scans for and defuses car bombs. Left click to scan the target vehicle for car bombs, and right click to defuse and remove the bomb if it exists.
data.user: All police jobs except undercover officer and mayor's bodyguard

data.name: Car Bomb Protection
data.desc: Prevents players from planting car bombs on the target vehicle. To apply to a vehicle, touch the item with the vehicle. If the vehicle is respawned, its car bomb protection status will be removed.

data.name: Vehicle Management Tool
data.desc: Tool with handy functions to make locked vehicles easier to tow. Left click to release the brakes on the target vehicle, and right click to rotate the vehicle 180 degrees.

data.name: Repair Tool
data.desc: Fixes broken vehicles. Left click to gradually repair the target vehicle, and right click to repair the target vehicle's tires.

data.name: Tow Equipment
data.desc: Attaches the tow truck to a vehicle that needs towed. To use, back your tow truck up to the very front of the target vehicle and left click while looking at the back of the tow truck.

data.name: Fuel Can
data.desc: Fills up a vehicle with fuel. To use, walk up to a vehicle and left click. The can holds an infinite amount of fuel and does not need refilled.

data.name: Bagged Deposit Box Money
data.desc: Bag of money that was stolen from a player's deposit box. To cash one in, press your use key on the bag near the banker NPC.

data.name: Deposit Boxes
data.desc: Stores money for players that accumulate interest over time. Both the banker and the owner of the deposit box will receive money from the interest. If the banker disconnects or changes jobs while money is still in the deposit boxes, that money will be automatically returned to its owner.
data.location: City bank, usually in a secure room near the vault.

data.name: Deposit Box Computer
data.desc: Displays details about a player's deposit box such as the original deposited amount and the current amount.
data.location: City bank, usually on a counter or desk near the deposit boxes.

data.name: Bronze Money Printer
data.desc: Lowest quality money printer out of the five. Prints $50 every 3 minutes.

data.name: Cable Tie
data.desc: Flimsy version of the police handcuffs. While not as strong, these have the ability to gag and blind players to prevent them from seeing or using voice chat.

data.name: Car Evictor
data.desc: Kicks the driver out of a vehicle and unlocks the vehicle's door.

data.name: Chloride
data.desc: One of the required ingredients for making meth. Goes into a meth pot.

data.name: Coca Plant
data.desc: Outputs raw cocaine after spending a certain amount of time under a heat lamp. Takes 20 minutes to grow.

data.name: Weed/Meth/Pure Cocaine
data.desc: Gives you boosts such as increased health or armor if consumed. Taking too much can result in an overdose, which can lead to negative effects such as low health and slower walk speed. These drugs can also be sold at the drug dealer. Prices vary depending on the type of drug.
data.other: Cooking or growing with various equipment and ingredients

data.name: Diamond Money Printer
data.desc: Prints $350 every minute.

data.name: Disguise Kit
data.desc: Changes the user's playermodel to the selected job's playermodel. To use, left click and press the number associated with the job you want to disguise as. Note that if you take damage while disguised, the disguise will be removed and you will freeze in place for a few seconds.

data.name: Flashbang
data.desc: Type of grenade that temporarily blinds players that look in the direction of the explosion.

data.name: Gas Can
data.desc: Used to pour gas on the ground. To use, hold left click and move in the direction you want the stream to go. To ignite the gas, stand near the pour gas and right click.

data.name: Gold Money Printer
data.desc: Cannot be put in your inventory. Prints $250 every minute.

data.name: Hacking Station
data.desc: Used to hack and view stats of all currently active drones. To hack, press your use key on the console and type 'hack'. You will be asked to enter a password. Once you enter the password, it will list the ID of all available drones. See the drones rewrite addon for more information.

data.name: Heat Lamp
data.desc: Provides heat to coca plants so they can grow. Has a 20% chance of catching fire every 5 minutes while turned on. Requires propane to work.

data.name: Leash
data.desc: Variant of the cable tie that allows players to drag constrained players with them. Press reload while looking at the target player to toggle the leash.

data.name: Meth Stove
data.desc: Cooks meth inside meth pots that have the proper ingredients in them. Requires propane to work.

data.name: Meth Pot
data.desc: Holds the ingredients used to cook meth. Place on a meth stove to start the cooking process once the required ingredients are inside. Press your use key on the pot to harvest the batch once its done cooking.

data.name: Molotov
data.desc: Throwable glass bottle that starts a fire wherever it lands.

data.name: Platinum Money Printer
data.desc: Prints $425 per minute.

data.name: Raw Cocaine
data.desc: Raw form of cocaine that is output by a coca plant. Insert it into the purifier to turn it into pure cocaine.

data.name: Silver Money Printer
data.desc: Prints $150 every 2 minutes.

data.name: Smoke Grenade
data.desc: Emits a cloud of smoke where it lands, making visibility very low.

data.name: Sodium
data.desc: One of the required ingredients for making meth. Goes into a meth pot.

data.name: Weed Plant
data.desc: Grows weed. Once the plant has fully grown, press your use key on it to harvest the weed and restart the growing cycle.

data.name: Seed
data.desc: Many different seeds can be purchased and planted in dirt. Once a plant has grown food, you can harvest the food to eat and restore health, or to sell for a profit at the farmer NPC.

data.name: Shipping Crate
data.desc: Transports grown crops to the farmer NPC to sell. To use, place the crate next to the farmer NPC and press your use key on the crate to empty it and receive a profit.

data.name: Defibrillator
data.desc: Revives dead players that haven't respawned yet. To use, right click multiple times to charge it up, then left click on a players corpse to revive them.

data.name: Fire Extinguisher
data.desc: Puts out fires by spraying a foam-like substance. Can be used an unlimited amount of times.

data.name: Med Kit
data.desc: Quickly heals players by intervals of 10. Players can be healed up to 150 HP if they are healed near an ambulance. Right click to heal yourself.

data.name: Narcan
data.desc: Cures any negative effects a player has from overdosing on drugs.

data.name: News Camera
data.desc: Broadcasts a live feed of what you're looking at to news TVs. You can edit the ticker that appears at the bottom of the screen by right clicking.

data.name: News TV
data.desc: Displays a live feed of the news cameraman's camera.

data.name: Axe
data.desc: Chops down trees. Firefighters can also use it to force open doors.

data.name: Rock
data.desc: Mined with a pickaxe. Yields ores and/or iron depending on rarity. The rarer the rock is, the more iron it will yield. The max amount of iron a rock can produce is 15. Max amount of ores is 6.
data.location: Scattered around the map, mostly outside of the city.

data.name: Mining Cart
data.desc: Holds up to 20 logs or ores, can be put in a grinder or sawmill for a profit. Ores and logs cannot be placed in the same cart at once. The cart needs to be emptied for its item type to reset.

data.name: Pickaxe
data.desc: Mines rocks.

data.name: Tree
data.desc: Yields logs that can be used in crafting or sold for a profit. Their leaves are always red/orange to help distinguish them from map trees.
data.location: Scattered around the map, mostly in wooded areas.

data.name: Car Bomb
data.desc: Special type of explosive used specifically on vehicles. Detonation conditions can be changed by right clicking with the bomb equipped.

data.name: Frag Grenade
data.desc: Throwable explosive that deals a great amount of damage for anyone nearby by launching fragments of it's metal shell outward.

data.name: Lockpick
data.desc: Used to silently break into locked buildings and vehicles. To use, walk up to a door or vehicle, left click, and wait for the picking to finish. Looking away from the object you're picking will reset your progress.

data.name: Nano Drone
data.desc: Small drone that is near impossible to detect without a hacking station. Does not emit a sound but also does not display as many stats as the spy drone.

data.name: Premium Lockpick
data.desc: Same as the normal lockpick except the lockpicking time is cut in half, it creates no sound, and it does not set off car alarms.

data.name: SLAM Remote Explosive
data.desc: Explosive that can be detonated remotely from anywhere on the map. It can also be placed on walls and used as a tripmine.

data.name: Spider Drone
data.desc: Has all of the abilities of the spy drone but it crawls instead of flies. It can also scale walls and walk on ceilings.

data.name: Timed C4
data.desc: Plastic explosive with a timer that does large amounts of damage. Timer can range from 0 seconds to 10 minutes.

data.name: Toy Turtle
data.desc: Hops around like a toy. Can be configured to play a different sound at a different speed by pressing your use key on it.

data.name: Wrench
data.desc: Crafting ingredient used in advanced weapon recipes.

data.name: Crafting Blueprint
data.desc: Crafting item for certain recipes. Comes in 3 tiers, which each tier containing better weapons. All blueprints get 3 uses before they are removed.
data.other: Dumpster diving, buying at supermarket, completing events, and robbing banks.

data.name: Small Sign/Blue Book
data.desc: Clipboard/book that allows you to edit and save text. You can transport this in your inventory, though it will not safe the text when the server closes. If you want to save the text, dupe the item.

data.name: Tip Jar
data.desc: Used to give money to a person without being physically near them.

data.name: 30% Vehicle Health
data.desc: Repairs a damaged vehicle by 30% of its max HP. To use, touch the kit with a damaged vehicle.

data.name: Business Sign
data.desc: Simple sign that displays the text 'Open' or 'Closed'. Press your use key on it to change its status.

data.name: Camera Drone
data.desc: Simple drone with a camera attached to it.

data.name: Crowbar
data.desc: Can be used as a weapon or a tool for prying open ATMs.

data.name: Crafting Table
data.desc: Used to craft other items such as weapons and tools with ingredients and blueprints.

data.name: Fuel Can
data.desc: Fills up 75% of a vehicle's fuel tank. To use, touch it with a vehicle that needs fuel.

data.name: Large Metal Detector
data.desc: Walk-through metal detector that can detect everything the handheld version can, as well as explosives and weapons in a players inventory. Requires a player to setup but not operate.

data.name: Life Alert
data.desc: Alerts police and EMS to your location when you type !alert in chat if you have it equipped. Press your use key on it to equip it.

data.name: Media Player TV
data.desc: Plays videos and music through a number of different websites including YouTube, Twitch, and Soundcloud. Press your use key to turn it on and hold C while looking at it to add media.

data.name: Propane Canister
data.desc: Contains propane for fueling the meth stove and heat lamp. To use, touch the canister with the stove or lamp and they will become welded to each other and ready to use. If needed, you can press your use key on the canister to detach it.

data.name: Slot Machine
data.desc: Casino game that has a chance of rewarding a large payout. Each spin will deduct $100 and can reward anywhere from $5 to $20,000.

data.name: Spy Drone
data.desc: Similar to the camera drone but can detect entities.

data.name: Alcohol Case
data.desc: What the keg spawns when it's done brewing an alcoholic drink. Each case contains 6 bottles that can be consumed to restore up to 40 hunger.
data.other: Brewing a drink with the keg.

data.name: Cooked Fish
data.desc: Output of the cooking stove. Can be eaten to restore 50 HP and 20 hunger.
data.other: Cooking a fish on the cooking stove.

data.name: Cooking Stove
data.desc: Cooks fish you catch as a cook. To use, press your use key on it after catching some fish. A pot will appear to indicate that your fish are cooking. The fish will appear on the stove once they are done.

data.name: Keg
data.desc: Creates alcoholic drinks using fruit and letting it brew for 100 seconds.

data.name: Keg Fruits
data.desc: Various fruits that can be placed in a keg to create specific drinks.

data.name: Microwave
data.desc: Quickly prepares a meal that restores full hunger. Yields a small profit for the cook.

data.name: Pizza Fridge
data.desc: Sells ingredients for making pizza. Dough is the pizza base, and everything else is a topping.

data.name: Pizza Oven
data.desc: Cooks completed pizzas. Automatically starts once a pizza is placed inside, and will make noise when the pizza is done.

data.name: One-Time-Use Health Kit
data.desc: Fully restores a players health, then removes itself.

data.name: One-Time-Use Armor Kit
data.desc: Fully restores a players armor, then removes itself.

data.name: Ammo Locker
data.desc: Supplies ammo for any gun. To use, press your use key on the locker and wait for the ammo to spawn on the ground. You will be charged a certain amount depending on the ammo type. Shotgun ammo is only obtainable by police jobs; civilians will need to craft it or steal it from the locker using a crowbar.
data.location: Supermarkets and secure areas of the police station.

data.name: Pot Hole
data.desc: Part of the roadwork event. Spawns in the road and has a chance of popping tires when a vehicle runs over it. It can be removed by a mechanic with a pickaxe.

data.name: Evidence
data.desc: Package that spawns near a player's corpse if there is a detective currently on the server. Detectives can investigate them to learn the name of the victim and the killer.

data.name: Fish Bait
data.desc: Lures fish to your rod. Each bait has 5 uses.

data.name: Fishing Rod
data.desc: Used to catch fish. Press reload to adjust your throwing strength and left click to cast your line. Once you start seeing splashes around your hook, right click to reel in what you caught.

data.name: Fish Finder
data.desc: Detects fish at different depths. Useful for seeing if the body of water you're fishing in is deep enough to contain rare fish. To use, hold it out while moving around a body of water.

data.name: Fishing Pot
data.desc: Automatically catches fish and stores them over time. It floats near the surface, so only common fish can be caught in it. To deploy it or harvest the fish inside, press your use key on it.

data.name: Fire Hose
data.desc: Similar to the fire extinguisher but has a larger range, at the cost of needing to be near a fire truck or fire hose node to work.

data.name: Fire Hose Node
data.desc: Extends the range of fire trucks so fire hoses can be used in hard to reach places such as an apartment building. They can be attached to a fire truck or another node. To use, press your use key on it and select an option from the menu.

data.name: SWAT Locker
data.desc: Used by police officers to equip SWAT gear. While SWAT, you have a much slower walk speed and cannot use certain NPCs such as the supermarket and contraband dealer. The locker keeps your current gear safe when you use it so you won't lose any weapons.
data.location: Secure areas of the police station.

data.name: Rock Scanner
data.desc: Displays the contents of rocks without needing to mine it. To use, press your primary fire while looking at a nearby rock.

data.name: Job Broker
data.desc: Allows players to take jobs and start special events for a price. The reward for completing the job is always the price of the job plus 50%.
data.location: Front desk of city hall.
